Award.AwardTitle: A Cultural Analysis of Kluane First Nation Land Claim Negotiations, Yukon
Award.AbstractNarration: Dr. Nadasdy, an assistant professor at the University of Wisconsin Madison, is proposing to do social/liguistic research among the Kluane First Nation (KFN) aboriginal people focusing on their aboriginal land claim negotiations with the Government of Canada and the Yukon Territorial Government. By combining anthropological methods of participant observation and interviews with archival research and in depth social/linguistic analysis of negotiation sessions, the researcher will be providing new insights into the struggle over cultural forms and meanings between the KFN and the dominant Euro-American governmental negotiators. This research is unique in its application of social/linguistic analysis to the cross-cultural negotiation process inherent in the research topic.
